intro: Siphocampylus elfriedii, commonly known as the elfried's siphocampylus, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided lobes, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
